cab.content: C(76) 15COPY NO o 416 February 1976 0 *CABINETREVIEW OF PARLIAMENTARY PROCEDUREMemorandum by the Lord President of the council. We undertook in The Queen'8 Speech to put forward proposals"for a major review of the practice and procedure of Parliament". On15 January, Cabinet discussed the scope and purpose of the review.There was general agreement that "the time was ripe for a major reviewof the kind proposed". I was invited to bring back specific proposals forthe conduct of the review after a debate in the House.2. The House debated the question on 2 February. There was virtuallyunanimous agreement from all parts of the House on the need for a far-reaching review along the lines I had indicated. I now attach for considerstion by my colleagues draft terms of reference for a House of CommonsS-sleet Committee which will make possible the type of review we have inmind and which reflects the debate la the House,3. During the debate on 2 February there was very marked oppositionto my suggestion that the Committee should include as full members a significant minority from outside the House. I have therefore veryreluctantly come to the conclusion that with such opposition it is not\ practical to press *ids point further. The terms of reference have,however, been drafted to allow the Committee to bring in outsiders in a' way that will allow them to play as full as possible a part In the work of theCommittee, but without being full members of the Committee and without being *Me to vote. Whether or not this power is used will be for theCommittee themselves to decide.4. I invite my colleagues to agree to the establishment of a SelectCommittee with the terms of reference proposed.E privy Council Office16 February 1976 ANNEXSELECT COMMITTEE ON PROCEDUREDRAFT ORDER OF REFERENCEThat a Select Committee be appointed to consider the practice and procedure of the House in relation to public business and to make recommendations for the more effective performance of its functionsThat the Committee do consist of ... Members.That ... be members of the Committee.That the Committee have power to send for persons, papers and records; to sit notwithstanding any Adjournment of the House;to report from time to time; and to report Minutes of evidence from time to time.That ... be the quorum of the Committee.That the Committee have power to appoint Sub-Committees and torefer to such Sub-Committees any of the matters referred to theCommittee.That every such Sub-Committee have power to send for persons,papers and records; to sit notwithstanding any Adjournment ofthe House; and to report to the Committee from time to time.That the Committee have power to report from time to time theMinutes of.the Evidence taken by and Memoranda laid before suchSub-Committees.That ... be the quorum of every such Sub-Committee.That the Committee have power to invite such persons as they mayselect to attend any of their meetings, and to take part in the deliberations of the Committee and in the examination of witnesses.That the Committee have power to appoint persons to carry out such work relating to the Committee's order of reference asthe Committee may determine.
